info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 03 at 3:13AM PST until December 05 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM PST MONDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches with 8 to 16 inches possible above 5000 feet. * WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County above 3500 feet. * WHEN...From 4 PM Saturday to 10 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest and most persistent snowfall will occur above and around 5,000 feet, including Mt Shasta Ski Park and highway 89 at Snowmans Summit. However, snow will occasionally impact I-5 and local roadways in Mt. Shasta City, especially at night and during heavier bursts. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
